title: See How Crops Get Picked Super Fast by Machines!

subtasks: Positioning the harvester in the field
Starting the harvester's engine
Guiding the harvester across the field
Monitoring the harvesting process

tasks.task: Managing the mechanical harvester's front unit
subtasks: Ensuring proper alignment of the rotating spindles
Adjusting spindle rotation for optimal fiber collection
Verifying the harvester's settings prevent plant damage
Inspecting harvested areas for undamaged crops

tasks.task: followed by each main task, each on a new line, then their respective subtasks. Like this:

subtasks: Positioning the harvester in the field
Starting the harvester's engine
Guiding the harvester across the field
Monitoring the harvesting process

tasks.task: Managing the mechanical harvester's front unit
subtasks: Ensuring proper alignment of the rotating spindles
Adjusting spindle rotation for optimal fiber collection
Verifying the harvester's settings prevent plant damage
Inspecting harvested areas for undamaged crops

tasks.task: because it's about ensuring the crops are not damaged. The subtasks there would be checking the machine's settings (like speed or spindle pressure? Perhaps the operator can adjust these manually) and physically inspecting the harvested areas.
